entry.title: The Company We Keep
entry.summary:
Author: WrenA

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,629Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 15

Summary: They say you can tell a person by the company they keep and all Barry could say about Superman was that he was far from the goodie-two-shoes everyone made him out to be initially. If you were to go by said company:- The colleagues at the Daily Planet and especially Lois and Jimmy- Clark's parents who always send sweets- Clark's close friend, Thomas, who sports a permanent stubble, disheveled hair and dark circles under the eyes- The mysterious 'B' who Superman sometimes calls to call in a favor when something requires a more tricky investigation- Nightwing, who is part of the league but acts incredibly familiar to Supes- An assortment of friends that he keeps mentioning- A (possible) crime lord whose file keeps getting deleted from the Watchtower databases- An array of vigilantes that absolutely refuse to join the league and have an unhealthy obsession for bats- THE BATMAN!? THE BATMAN IS REAL and does Superman know BATMAN!?- Lex Luthor, a homicidal billionaire- Bruce Wayne, not a homicidal billionaire, just annoying- Superman's kids?!? Or glimpses into the life of Superman over time, as seen through the eyes of one Barry Allen.

entry.title: Friends
entry.summary:
Author: NotCassia

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,554Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 10

Summary: Green Arrow pulled out one of his air pods from his right ear, reaching over to the ear of Batman's cowl and PULLING BATMAN'S COWL OFF HIS HEAD!   Barry gasped, taking a sharp step back [which, in Barry-speak, means he zipped halfway towards the exit], while Clark could only stare endlessly.   Batman—Bruce, stood stock still, posture suddenly and sharply rigid. His expression remaining neutral while his eyes, in stark contrast, sharpened with promise of ruin.   Green Arrow wasn't even in the slightest fazed, putting his right ear's airpod in Bruce's ear before returning his attention to his phone—bobbing his head to the music. Even returning his right elbow to Bruce's headrest, encroaching on his personal space.   Bruce's brows barely twitched, as if adjusting to the music in his ear. Before returning his gaze to his tablet, working as if nothing had happened.   Clark and Barry were gaping.

entry.title: Cats and Dogs
entry.summary:
Author: riversiders

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 64,856Chapters: 12/16Kudos: 228

Summary: It's not that he doesn't like Clark. He’s obsessed with Clark, actually, and not just because he somehow conned his way into dating him. As suspicious and crazy as it makes Bruce feel, he cannot deny that Clark cares. He’s constantly checking in on Bruce. They talk on the phone practically every day, and Superman has become a frequent and regular visitor at Wayne Manor. Dick adores him. Alfred does too. He keeps making hints about ‘letting Mr. Kent into the club in an official capacity’. Clark is wonderful. He is good—too good. He won't treat Bruce the way Bruce wants to be treated.

entry.title: Formalwear and Other Weapons
entry.summary:
Author: brmqtr

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,574Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 4

Summary: When the Justice League hosts a charity gala with a bring-your-partner theme, Bruce Wayne and Clark Kent attend together expecting nothing worse than bad music and worse speeches. Instead, villains interpret their presence as proof of a terrifying new alliance. As rumors spiral, tuxedos become tactical gear, damage control becomes impossible, and one very public kiss is deployed as the most efficient solution available. A comedic ensemble fic about misunderstandings, strategic affection, and letting the world assume whatever it wants.

entry.title: Home Between Stars and Stone
entry.summary:
Author: brmqtr

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,630Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 2

Summary: Superman and Batman are in a relationship, but their homes couldn’t be more different—one a crystalline fortress floating in solitude, the other a cave of shadows beneath a city that never sleeps. Between zero-gravity meditation fails, caffeine disasters, blanket forts, and unlikely alliances (Alfred and Krypto, obviously), Clark and Bruce try to build something softer, warmer, and surprisingly domestic. Because sometimes love means bringing sunlight into the dark, and sometimes it just means feeding your partner and letting him nap in peace.

entry.title: Getting Over You With You
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,849Chapters: 5/15Kudos: 31

Summary: Bruce Wayne has always been careful—about business, about Gotham, and especially about people. That is, until he meets Clark Kent. Sharp, earnest, and unflinchingly curious, Clark isn’t just another reporter looking for a story—he’s the kind of person Bruce finds impossible to ignore. But there’s a complication: Clark Kent is in love with someone else. Someone who wears a mask, prowls the shadows, and doesn’t exist in the daylight world Clark inhabits. Bruce watches, patiently, navigating the line between desire and discretion, as Clark wrestles with his feelings for the Dark Knight. As they grow closer—through follow-up interviews, quiet conversations, and tentative dates—Clark begins to confront what he truly wants, and Bruce begins to realize just how much he’s willing to risk for someone who doesn’t even know he exists outside the mask (the mask that is Bruce Wayne).

entry.summary:
Author: brmqtr

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,518Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 7

Summary: When blurry photos surface of Superman leaving Wayne Tower at sunrise, Gotham goes into a gossip spiral. Bruce panics. Clark laughs. Tim starts selling merch. But as the world speculates, Bruce is left with a choice: keep hiding the love that’s changed him, or step into the light with the one person who’s never asked him to. A romantic drama about rooftop truths, stubborn hearts, and the quiet courage to be known.

entry.title: Azure Catching the Moonlight
entry.summary:
Author: RenaiRin

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 103,154Chapters: 9/10Kudos: 716

Summary: “Clark? What’s wrong?” Bruce asked under his breath. His growing concern only caused the blood in his veins to hitch. The stone faced stare before him did not budge, not even a millimeter. He had to tilt his head back a little against the wall to look properly at the face cloaked in shadows before him. The smell of blood was stronger now. ”You’re injured.” It was only then that Bruce could see Clark's eyes, his pupils were almost completely constricted. Like he had tunnel vision. But upon closer inspection, his usual azure gaze had a strange circular ring of pink on the outskirts of the irises. ------ Or, Bruce and Clark explore the after effects of Pink Kryptonite.

entry.title: Seven minutes in heaven
entry.summary:
Author: NightWrites_leaf

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 222,959Chapters: 33/?Kudos: 652

Summary: Dick Grayson thought it would be harmless, one chill night where the Young Justice crew and the Titans could actually relax together. No missions. No explosions. Just friends, laughter… and maybe a little too much alcohol. But when a round of Never Have I Ever spirals into Seven Minutes in Heaven, Dick and Wally find themselves a little too close in the dark — and suddenly, nothing feels simple anymore.
